title: Pull and Combine Urban Water Reporting Datasets
text: UWDtap connects four distinct water reporting datasets allow users download compile urban water data across reporting requirements single function call. UWDtap pulls data following reports: Conservation Report (CR) Electronic Annual Report (EAR) Urban Water Management Plan (UWMP) Water Loss Audit (WLA) Many retail wholesale water agencies across California required submit reports Department Water Resources State Water Board. Currently user must dowload many datasets 4 distinct web portals preform analysis urban water data. data standardized across reporting requirements even many reporting requirements collect data. goal package provide service pulls data preforms basic standardization - generating analysis ready data.

title: Pull and Combine Urban Water Reporting Datasets
Pull and Combine Urban Water Reporting Datasets
text: UWDtap exposes several useful functions pull visualize data urban water reporting data. main function package pull_data(), data returned, Visualize data specific category pwsid, Note: package QA/QC data. preform basic mapping fields data can compared across reports.
code: # download data from all reporting requirements for 2020 urban_water_data <- pull_data(year_selection = 2020) urban_water_data |> glimpse()  Rows: 1,120,132 Columns: 9 $ report_name   <chr> "UWMP", "UWMP", "UWMP", "UWMP", "UWMP", "UWMP", "UWMP", "UWMP", "UWMP", "UWMP", "UWMP", "UWMP", "UWMP", … $ pwsid         <chr> "CA3610001", "CA3610001", "CA3610001", "CA3610001", "CA3610001", "CA3610001", "CA3610001", "CA0110001", … $ supplier_name <chr> "Adelanto  City Of", "Adelanto  City Of", "Adelanto  City Of", "Adelanto  City Of", "Adelanto  City Of",… $ year          <dbl> 2020, 2020, 2020, 2020, 2020, 2020, 2020, 2020, 2020, 2020, 2020, 2020, 2020, 2020, 2020, 2020, 2020, 20… $ month         <dbl> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, … $ category      <chr> "demand", "demand", "demand", "demand", "demand", "demand", "demand", "demand", "demand", "demand", "dem… $ use_type      <chr> "multi-family", "commercial", "industrial", "landscape", "other potable", "losses", "single family", "in… $ volume_af     <dbl> 162, 809, 0, 82, 1, 987, 2606, 2410, 4245, 1064, 5463, 83, 4483, 1569, 0, 7190, 463, 18762, 7813, 2994, … $ use_group     <chr> "residential", "commerical industrial institutional", "commerical industrial institutional", "landscape"… urban_water_data |>       plot_data(selected_category = "supply",                pwsid = "",                 show_subcategories = FALSE)

title: Plot Urban Water Data — plot_data
text: function generates simple visualization Urban Water Data.

title: Plot Urban Water Data — plot_data
code: plot_data(   data,   category_selection = c("supply", "supply total", "demand", "demand total", "losses"),   pwsid_selection,   show_subcategories = FALSE )

title: Plot Urban Water Data — plot_data
text: data Data plot. Must format outputted pull_data() funciton category_selection category user like plotted. Coverage accross reporting requirements varies category. Can "supply", "supply total", "demand", "demand total", "losses" pwsid_selection Public Water Sysetm Identification Number (PWSID) corresponding agency whose data like visualize. show_subcategories Defaults FALSE. set TRUE shows subcategoreis use types.

title: Plot Urban Water Data — plot_data
code: plot_data(category_selection = "demand", pwsid = "CA3610001") #> Error in filter(data, category == category_selection, pwsid == pwsid_selection): argument "data" is missing, with no default

text: Pulls data CR, EAR, UWMP, WLA compiles single format.

title: Pull Data — pull_data
